sense.def: Pathological Condition Combined Designation of dian bing 癲病 , peak disease, and jing bing 痙病 , spasms disease. Shen nong ben cao jing 神農本草經 Substance Entry liu chu mao ti jia 六畜毛蹄甲：主鬼疰蠱毒，寒熱，癲痙狂走 , “It controls demon attachment-illness and gu poison , cold and heat spells, as well as peak-illness with spasms and crazy running”. Dian kuang 癲狂 , peak-illness and madness [11]

Pathological Condition of mental disturbance. Based on a patient’s condition of silence or restlessness one may distinguish between the two types of dian 癲 , peak-illness, and kuang 狂 , madness. Ling shu 靈樞 22 has a chapter with the title Dian kuang 癲 狂：癲疾始生，先不樂，頭重痛…狂始發，少臥不飢，自高賢也，自辯 智也，自尊貴也，善罵詈，日夜不休 , “When peak-illness just begins, [patients] at first are not joyful, their head feels heavy and has pain. …When madness breaks out for the first time, [patients] do not lie down much and they have no appetite. They think of themselves as the greatest, wisest, and worthiest. They tend to insult and curse others, and this goes on day and night”.
